type.name: section
type.title: Undesirable person may be prohibited from entering Guyana.
type.context: EXPULSION OF UNDESIRABLES ACT under Undesirable person may be prohibited from entering Guyana. 3.  Should the President have reason to believe that an undesirable person is about to arrive or may arrive in Guyana he may make an order against such person prohibiting him from entering Guyana. Thereupon such person shall not be permitted to enter Guyana, but if, after service upon him of the order, he does so enter, he may be apprehended without warrant by any member of the police force and shall be deported from Guyana.
type.description: Should the President have reason to believe that an undesirable person is about to arrive or may arrive in Guyana he may make an order against such person prohibiting him from entering Guyana. type.name: section
type.title: Undesirable person may be ordered to leave Guyana.
type.context: EXPULSION OF UNDESIRABLES ACT under Undesirable person may be ordered to leave Guyana. 4.  The  President  may at  any time  make  an  order  against  an undesirable person requiring him to leave Guyana within a time fixed by the order and thereafter to remain out of Guyana, or directing that such person be apprehended by any member of the police force and be deported from Guyana. The President may extend the time fixed by any such order.

The President may extend the time fixed by any such order.

type.name: section
type.title: Contravention of expulsion order requiring person to leave Guyana.
type.context: EXPULSION OF UNDESIRABLES ACT under Contravention of expulsion order requiring person to leave Guyana. 6. (1) Any person required to leave Guyana by an expulsion order who shall be within Guyana after the expiration of the time fixed by the order or of any extension thereof allowed by the President shall be guilty of an offence.  (2) Any such person may be apprehended without warrant by any member of the police force and shall be deported from Guyana forthwith or after he shall have served any term of imprisonment imposed on him for his offence.

description.description: Any person required to leave Guyana by an expulsion order who shall be within Guyana after the expiration of the time fixed by the order or of any extension thereof allowed by the President shall be guilty of an offence.

Any such person may be apprehended without warrant by any member of the police force and shall be deported from Guyana forthwith or after he shall have served any term of imprisonment imposed on him for his offence.

type.name: section
type.title: Return to Guyana after expulsion.
type.context: EXPULSION OF UNDESIRABLES ACT under Return to Guyana after expulsion. 7. (1) Any person who, having left Guyana in compliance with an expulsion order or having  been  deported  therefrom  under  or for  disobedience  to  any  such  order,  returns  to  Guyana  shall  be guilty of an offence, unless previous to his return such order shall have been revoked or suspended or the President shall have authorised such person to return.  (2) Any such person may be apprehended without warrant by any member of the police force  and  shall  be deported from Guyana forthwith or after he shall have served any term of imprisonment imposed on him for his offence.

Any such person may be apprehended without warrant by any member of the police force  and  shall  be deported from Guyana forthwith or after he shall have served any term of imprisonment imposed on him for his offence.

type.name: section
type.title: Custody pending deportation.
type.context: EXPULSION OF UNDESIRABLES ACT under Custody pending deportation.  8. (1) Any person apprehended under or for disobedience to an expulsion order shall, pending deportation from Guyana, be detained in custody in such place and manner as the President may direct. type.name: section
type.title: Deportation.
type.context: EXPULSION OF UNDESIRABLES ACT under Deportation. 9.  (1) Any person liable  to  be  deported under  this  Act  shall  be deported in such manner as the President may direct.  (2) The President may seize and apply any money or property of any such  person  in  payment  of  the  whole  or  any  part  of  the expenses of or incidental to his deportation and to his maintenance in custody pending deportation.

type.name: section
type.title: Harbouring person contravening this Act.
type.context: EXPULSION OF UNDESIRABLES ACT under Harbouring person contravening this Act.  10.  Any person who harbours any other person whom he knows or has reasonable grounds for believing to be acting in contravention of this Act shall be guilty of an offence.
type.description: Any person who harbours any other person whom he knows or has reasonable grounds for believing to be acting in contravention of this Act shall be guilty of an offence.

type.name: section
type.title: Prosecution and punishment of offences.
type.context: EXPULSION OF UNDESIRABLES ACT under Prosecution and punishment of offences. 11. (1) Every offence against this Act shall be prosecuted under the Summary Jurisdiction Acts.  (2) Every person who is convicted of an offence against this Act shall be liable to a fine of forty-eight thousand seven hundred and fifty dollars and to imprisonment for six months.

type.name: section
type.title: Lapsing, revocation and suspension of expulsion orders.
type.context: EXPULSION OF UNDESIRABLES ACT under Lapsing, revocation and suspension of expulsion orders.  12. (1) Should any person apprehended under or for disobedience to  an  expulsion order  not  be  deported  from  Guyana  within  six weeks after  his apprehension or after  the   expiration  of  any term  of imprisonment imposed on him for an offence against this Act he shall be released from custody and the order shall lapse and cease to have force.  (2) The President may at any time revoke an expulsion order absolutely or suspend its operation simply or subject to such conditions as he may think fit.
